alert.note: Alert for Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HART...WEST CENTRAL LAURENS...SOUTH CENTRAL GREENVILLE...CENTRAL ANDERSON AND NORTHEASTERN ABBEVILLE COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Anderson, or near Belton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Homeland Park, Belton, Northlake, Honea Path, Due West, Donalds, Starr, Anderson Airport, and Lake Hartwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
